icap.services.resources.gs
Class HttpMessage

java.lang.Object
  icap.services.resources.gs.HttpMessage

public class HttpMessage
extends java.lang.Object

Class used to provide HTTP message to native scripts Provides several methods of common use to manipulate content

Author:
Karel

Constructor Detail

HttpMessage

public HttpMessage(AbstractService service,
                   Icap.TYPE type,
                   java.lang.String requestHeaders,
                   java.lang.String requestBody,
                   java.lang.String responseHeaders,
                   java.lang.String responseBody,
                   java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String usergroup,
                   java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> sharedCache)
Construct an HTTP message instance that will be processed by a Java native script

Parameters:
service - ICAP service called
type - ICAP message type (either REQ or RESP)
requestHeaders - HTTP Request headers
requestBody - HTTP Request body (for POST mainly)
responseHeaders - HTTP Response headers
responseBody - HTTP Response body (if any)
username - User Name as extracted from ICAP or HTTP headers (see services.properties)
usergroup - User Group as extracted from ICAP or HTTP headers (see services.properties)
sharedCache - shared hash map used to store data to share between scripts

                                     java.lang.String requestHeaders,

                                     java.lang.String username,

                                     java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> sharedCache)
Convenient method used to generate an HTTP message instance in REQ mode

Parameters:
service - ICAP service called
requestHeaders - HTTP Request headers
requestBody - HTTP Request body (for POST mainly)
username - User Name as extracted from ICAP or HTTP headers (see services.properties)
usergroup - User Group as extracted from ICAP or HTTP headers (see services.properties)
sharedCache - shared hash map used to store data to share between scripts
Returns:
HttpMessage

Returns:
User Group as authenticated by Squid, or User-Agent header as fallback

request header value, or null if non existing

Returns:

getBody

public java.lang.String getBody()
Retrieve Message body (either request or response body depending on the message type) Specific REQ/RESP access not needed as REQBODY is not provided in RESPMODE

Returns:
HTTP Message body (either request or response body depending on the message type)

newHeader - the new header to set

addHeader

public void addHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                      java.lang.String headerValue)
Add given header to HTTP Message This method does not override existing headers with same name

Parameters:
headerName - the Header name to add
headerValue - the header value to add

deleteHeader

public void deleteHeader(java.lang.String headerName)
Delete given header in HTTP Message header

Parameters:
headerName - the header to delete (case sensitive)

getType

public java.lang.String getType()
Returns:
either Request Method in REQMOD, or Status code in RESPMOD
